page.title: 14CIMLA HOSPITAL
page.content: My mother is a ward clerk at Cimla hospital.She admits and discharges patients and is responsible for 3 wards.There are 5 wards plus a day unit.The wards are Hafod(geriatric long stay),Clyne(dermatology),Rheola (general medicine and chest),Glannant and Brynnedd(geriatric short stay) and the day hospital.The day unit admits patients daily from their homes.They are brought by ambulance.They are seen by a doctor and may be treated by a physiotherapist, chiropodist or speech therapist.They may shower or bath, have lunch and tea.They go home by ambulance in the evening. Previously the hospital was for tuberculosis but this disease is rare in the area now. All patients in the hospital are given a hospital number. This and details of each patient,past and present, is filed on a computer for rapid access.
